metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9938 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
contrib/completion/git-prompt.sh in Git before 1.9.3 does not sanitize branch names in the PS1 variable, allowing a malicious repository to cause code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-all - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-arch - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-core - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-cvs - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-daemon-run - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-el - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-email - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-gui - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-man - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-mediawiki - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
git-svn - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
gitk - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
gitweb - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: git package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1').
